title: How to Draw Tangled

steps.headline: Near the topmost center of the paper, draw a large circle for her head.
Attach a U-like shape below the circle for her chin and jaw.
Draw a slightly diagonal vertical line at the center of the circle, going towards where the U-shape is.
steps.description: To this line intersect two perpendicular line as a guide to her eyes and other face details. Next, draw an irregular box attached at the very right side of the paper. Attach two curved lines to connect the head to this box. To the top side and corner of the box, draw a circle for one of her shoulders. Draw also a similarly sized circle at the low corner nearest to the neck.

steps.headline: Using the guide lines for the face, draw her excited, wide eyes; then her eyebrows, nose, lips and ears.
steps.description: You may start outlining her forehead.

steps.headline: On the irregular box and shoulder circles, start tracing her neck, body and dress details.
Draw Rapunzel's long flowing hair, drawn down by gravity.
Color the drawing as desired (with her hair preferably golden blonde).
Near the topmost part of the paper, draw a circle for her head.
Attach a U-like shape below the circle for her chin and jaw.
steps.description: Draw an irregular box for her upper torso and attach another one beneath it to serve as her stomach part. Connect the head and torso with a line.

steps.headline: Attach another irregular box as her hips.
steps.description: Beneath it, connect a pair of long rectangles for her legs, then trace the outline of her feet.

steps.headline: Draw a pair of circles at the upper part of the torso.
steps.description: On each circles, attach angled lines as a stick guide to her arms. Place a circle on each tip of these lines.

steps.headline: Draw a slightly diagonal vertical line at the center of the circle, going towards where the U-shape is.
steps.description: To this line intersect two perpendicular line as a guide to her eyes and other face details.

steps.headline: Using the guide lines for the face, draw her excited, wide eyes; then her eyebrows, nose, lips and ears.
steps.description: Draw the outline of her chin and cheeks.

steps.headline: Start tracing her body, limbs, hair and dress outlines.
Color the drawing as desired (with her hair preferably golden blonde).

tyn: Colored pencils, crayons, markers or watercolors
text: Rapunzel (Close-Up) Near the topmost center of the paper, draw a large circle for her head.  Attach a U-like shape below the circle for her chin and jaw.  Draw a slightly diagonal vertical line at the center of the circle, going towards where the U-shape is. To this line intersect two perpendicular line as a guide to her eyes and other face details. Next, draw an irregular box attached at the very right side of the paper. Attach two curved lines to connect the head to this box. To the top side and corner of the box, draw a circle for one of her shoulders. Draw also a similarly sized circle at the low corner nearest to the neck. Using the guide lines for the face, draw her excited, wide eyes; then her eyebrows, nose, lips and ears. You may start outlining her forehead. On the irregular box and shoulder circles, start tracing her neck, body and dress details.  Draw Rapunzel's long flowing hair, drawn down by gravity.  Erase unnecessary lines.  Color the drawing as desired (with her hair preferably golden blonde).  Rapunzel (Full Body) Near the topmost part of the paper, draw a circle for her head.  Attach a U-like shape below the circle for her chin and jaw. Draw an irregular box for her upper torso and attach another one beneath it to serve as her stomach part. Connect the head and torso with a line. Attach another irregular box as her hips. Beneath it, connect a pair of long rectangles for her legs, then trace the outline of her feet. Draw a pair of circles at the upper part of the torso. On each circles, attach angled lines as a stick guide to her arms. Place a circle on each tip of these lines. Draw a slightly diagonal vertical line at the center of the circle, going towards where the U-shape is. To this line intersect two perpendicular line as a guide to her eyes and other face details. Using the guide lines for the face, draw her excited, wide eyes; then her eyebrows, nose, lips and ears. Draw the outline of her chin and cheeks. Start tracing her body, limbs, hair and dress outlines.  Draw accessories.  Add dress and hair details.  Erase unnecessary lines.  Color the drawing as desired (with her hair preferably golden blonde).
sentences: Rapunzel (Close-Up) Near the topmost center of the paper, draw a large circle for her head.
Attach a U-like shape below the circle for her chin and jaw.
Draw a slightly diagonal vertical line at the center of the circle, going towards where the U-shape is.
To this line intersect two perpendicular line as a guide to her eyes and other face details.
Next, draw an irregular box attached at the very right side of the paper.
Attach two curved lines to connect the head to this box.
To the top side and corner of the box, draw a circle for one of her shoulders.
Draw also a similarly sized circle at the low corner nearest to the neck.
Using the guide lines for the face, draw her excited, wide eyes; then her eyebrows, nose, lips and ears.
You may start outlining her forehead.
On the irregular box and shoulder circles, start tracing her neck, body and dress details.
Draw Rapunzel's long flowing hair, drawn down by gravity.
Erase unnecessary lines.
Color the drawing as desired (with her hair preferably golden blonde).
Rapunzel (Full Body) Near the topmost part of the paper, draw a circle for her head.
Attach a U-like shape below the circle for her chin and jaw.
Draw an irregular box for her upper torso and attach another one beneath it to serve as her stomach part.
Connect the head and torso with a line.
Attach another irregular box as her hips.
Beneath it, connect a pair of long rectangles for her legs, then trace the outline of her feet.
Draw a pair of circles at the upper part of the torso.
On each circles, attach angled lines as a stick guide to her arms.
Place a circle on each tip of these lines.
Draw a slightly diagonal vertical line at the center of the circle, going towards where the U-shape is.
To this line intersect two perpendicular line as a guide to her eyes and other face details.
Using the guide lines for the face, draw her excited, wide eyes; then her eyebrows, nose, lips and ears.
Draw the outline of her chin and cheeks.
Start tracing her body, limbs, hair and dress outlines.
Draw accessories.
Add dress and hair details.
Erase unnecessary lines.
Color the drawing as desired (with her hair preferably golden blonde).
